page.title: 05Farm Life at Carisbrooke.
page.content: The farmer at Read's Farm begins his day at 6.00 with the milking and this continues until 8.30 or 9.00.During the morning the farmer may fertilize the fields, check on the health of the young calves or work on maintainance jobs around the farm.In the afternoon he may be working on the fields, manure spreading.At about 14.30 the tanker will arrive to collect the milk. At 16.00 milking will begin again.The farm day will vary according to the time of year.Spring and early Summer is a very busy time as silage cutting takes place from 8.00 until 21.00. The farmer says that one of his biggest problems is the present E.E.C. quota level for milk production. Another is that he receives only about eight pence for a pint (568 ml) of milk which sells for twenty-two pence.
